javelin.model.world.location.dungeon

Class Dungeon

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.model.world.WorldActor
      • javelin.model.world.location.Location
        • javelin.model.world.location.dungeon.Dungeon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TempleDungeon

    public class Dungeon
extends Location
    A dungeon is an underground area of the world where the combats are harder but have extra treasure laying around. The in-game logic for dungeons is that they are a hideout of bandits or similar, which is why they are sacrificeable by Incursions and are removed from the game after a Squad leaves one (in this case it's assumed the bandits packed their stuff and left).
    Author:
    alex
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • SIZE

        public static final int SIZE
        Screen dimensions.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ENCOUNTERRATIO

        public static final float ENCOUNTERRATIO
        Assumes you will explore all the dungeon, being able to rest at the fountain mid-way for a total of 8 moderate encounters. This ignores the returning path towards the exit and getting to and from the dungeon itself, which means squads are supposed to be well equipped before diving in.

      • STEPSPERENCOUNTER

        public static final int STEPSPERENCOUNTER
        Approximate number of steps per encounter.

      • STARTING

        public static final java.lang.Integer STARTING
        Number of starting dungeons in the World map. Since Keys are important to Winning the game this should be a fair amount, otherwise the player will depend only on Caravans if too many dungeons are destroyed or if unable to find the proper Chest inside the dungeons he does find. Not that dungeons also spawn during the course of a game but since this is highly randomized a late-game player who ran out of dungeons should not be required to depend on that alone.
        See Also:
        WorldActor.destroy(Incursion), FeatureGenerator

      • getel

        protected java.lang.Integer getel(int attackel)
        Description copied from class: Location
        Only called for Location.sacrificeable places when being reached by an Incursion.
        Specified by:
        getel in class Location
        Parameters:
        attackel - Given an attacking encounter level...
        Returns:
        the defending encounter level. A null value is allowed because some places should not be conquered. Integer.MIN_VALUE means an automatic victory for the attacker.
        See Also:
        WorldActor.impermeable, Incursion.fight(int, int)

      • getextrafeatures

        protected java.util.List<Feature> getextrafeatures(java.util.Set<Point> free,
                                                   java.util.Set<Point> used)
        Similar to placefeatures(Set, Set) but usually reserved to placing TempleDungeon Features. Called after placing all basic features.
        Parameters:
        used - Don't forget to update this as you generate new features!
        Returns:
        Extra features to be placed using build(Feature, Set).

      • getcombatants

        public java.util.List<Combatant> getcombatants()
        Specified by:
        getcombatants in class WorldActor
        Returns:
        Any combatants that are situated in this actor, may return null if this is not a valid request for this type of actor. For performance if a List is returned it should be the canonical one, and thus should not be directly modified by the receiver.
        See Also:
        Combatant.newid()
